item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: The Prime Target portion of the calculator is dead. My numbers don't change whether I have it on or not.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: They've thrown in newer dances. i didn't have the sense of mind to keep track, but it totally cost me the rave

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
I think bonuses don't count under certain circumstances.
My first dance of the day using flipping out was rocking. I have a level of 0 in rocking.
I had with me Case of Glowsticks, Rising Star, The Light Fantastic, Full Cosplay, and a cool of 12.
I got 1 single point from that dance.

My guess is either that bonuses don't count when using flipping out, or bonuses don't count when your base level in a skill is 0. If someone else can verify it…

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Fateful Meeting unlocks a new activity at the Rave, training with the person you meet to gain extra Glowslinging dues for that day. It's also most likely required to advance past the third Miku boss in Billy Idol.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Ah, I guess that's the last effect from there. No idea what it does, I haven't even gotten glowslinger yet. Workin' on the lvl 4's, though.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
It's 'Fateful Meeting' not 'Fateful Encounter'.

Fateful Meeting: You've caught the eye of a hot dancer! Maybe you'll meet again.. (Permanent)

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: I figured you'd done so, but I asked you to verify so that anyone keeping pace- or reading the posts- would know it's been fixed.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Yep, it works. I'm watching the page, so when Ren reverted the code, I checked it.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Looks like ren po Ken has fixed that; Give it another try, Jim?

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Calculator's broken. Put in my stats, hit update, and the min/max/avg/etc aren't showing up.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Yes, the effects from the main events, Rising Star, Glowslinger, Prime Target, and Master of Disguise, and any other ones that haven't been discovered yet, are permanent.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
The exit text for glowslinger, the similarly-dressed guys with sunglasses and glowsticks…most likely a reference to the antagonists of Dub This!, the Tokyo Joes. Given that DT is linked from the animecubed homepage, I'd bet good ryo on it.

Edit: Oh, derp, didn't read the description for the effect on the main BC page. If an admin could just delete this…I wish we could delete our own comments…

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: The Awesome part is pretty much faked, the real effect is different. Some say it's Glowslinger.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
You finish dancing, and stagger out of the Rave. That was certainly a lot of fun - and who knows, maybe you turned a head or two!

A crowd watches you go - in awe of your mad skills. Word spreads like wildfire, and you know that everyone will be waiting to see you next time..

You got Rising Star!

You got +4 Cool, +200 Dance/Flipping Out/Posing XP,
Rising Star!

that is all the text for getting a score of 800

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Double the Mastery bonus (so either x3 if it's additive like most multipliers are or x4 if it's multiplicative). Prime Target is very much a positive effect, as I would assume most permanent effects are.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Now, this may sound silly, but the Prime Target thing…does that mean that if you have the lvl 4 required for mastery, that it would double again, as mastery already doubles your roll? Or would it double the required level to 8? I'm hoping the former, the latter would be a heck of a penalty, but prime target didn't exactly sound like a beneficial effect…
